intro: Cyrtandra haupuensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. Cyrtandra haupuensis is considered an endemic species, meaning it is found nowhere else in the world.
